intro: Viola mutabilis, commonly known as the common violet, is a flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves and showy flowers that range in color from violet to white. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with five petals, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Viola mutabilis is often found in woodlands, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
